SUMMARY: NESTED | FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD DETAIL: FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD

net.sf.openrds
Interface ISystemProperties

public interface ISystemProperties

Holds constants that indentify system properties read by OpenRDS.

Author:
Rodrigo

Field Summary
static java.lang.String BASE_IP
          This property can be used on machines with more than one network adaptor to set which one to use.

Eg: Suppose you have one adaptor with ip "200.206.xxx.xxx" (external ip) and another one with ip "192.168.xxx.xxx" (LAN ip).
You can set this property to "192." to tell the distributed system to use the network adaptor connected on the LAN.

The system will use the first network interface found that STARTS with the value of this property, so you don't need to specify the full ip address.
If the system cannot find any matching network interface, it will use the loopback interface provided by the operating system (usually "127.0.0.1").
static java.lang.String CLOCK_AMOUNT
          This property can be used to set the clock amount (MHz) of all nodes started on this JVM.
If this property is not set when calling NodeFactory.startProcessNode(), it will use a JNI library to determine the clock in MHz.
static java.lang.String CONNECT_TIMEOUT
          This property can be used to define the timeout for "create socket" operations.
All remote method calls are handled by socket transport layer.
If a node crashes, it will not be possible to connect to it anymore, but this situation is only detected when a socket timeout happens.
The default "create socket" timeout is 10000 (10 seconds).
You can lower/raise this value on more/less reliable environments.
static java.lang.String MEMORY_AMOUNT
          This property can be used to set the memory amount of all nodes started on this JVM.
If this property is not set when calling NodeFactory.startProcessNode(), it will use a JNI library to determine the physical memory of this machine.
static java.lang.String RECONNECTION_INTERVAL
          This property can be used to override the default interval for reconnection tentatives.
A process node enters in a "disconnected" mode after detecting any communication error with the main node, after that it will keep trying to restabilish the connection continuously at every interval.
The default reconnection interval is 5000 (5 seconds).
static java.lang.String VERIFICATION_INTERVAL
          This property can be used to override the default connection verification interval (in milliseconds) between a process node and the main node.
This verification is used to detect disconnections.
 

Field Detail

BASE_IP

public static final java.lang.String BASE_IP
This property can be used on machines with more than one network adaptor to set which one to use.

Eg: Suppose you have one adaptor with ip "200.206.xxx.xxx" (external ip) and another one with ip "192.168.xxx.xxx" (LAN ip).
You can set this property to "192." to tell the distributed system to use the network adaptor connected on the LAN.

The system will use the first network interface found that STARTS with the value of this property, so you don't need to specify the full ip address.
If the system cannot find any matching network interface, it will use the loopback interface provided by the operating system (usually "127.0.0.1").

See Also:
Constant Field Values
Value:
"openrds.base.ip"

MEMORY_AMOUNT

public static final java.lang.String MEMORY_AMOUNT
This property can be used to set the memory amount of all nodes started on this JVM.
If this property is not set when calling NodeFactory.startProcessNode(), it will use a JNI library to determine the physical memory of this machine.

See Also:
Constant Field Values
Value:
"openrds.memory.amount"

CLOCK_AMOUNT

public static final java.lang.String CLOCK_AMOUNT
This property can be used to set the clock amount (MHz) of all nodes started on this JVM.
If this property is not set when calling NodeFactory.startProcessNode(), it will use a JNI library to determine the clock in MHz.

See Also:
Constant Field Values
Value:
"openrds.clock.amount"

VERIFICATION_INTERVAL

public static final java.lang.String VERIFICATION_INTERVAL
This property can be used to override the default connection verification interval (in milliseconds) between a process node and the main node.
This verification is used to detect disconnections. Everytime a disconnection is detected, the node will keep trying to restabilish it continuously with a shorter interval. (See RECONNECTION_INTERVAL).
The default interval is 30000 (30 seconds).

See Also:
Constant Field Values
Value:
"openrds.verification.interval"

RECONNECTION_INTERVAL

public static final java.lang.String RECONNECTION_INTERVAL
This property can be used to override the default interval for reconnection tentatives.
A process node enters in a "disconnected" mode after detecting any communication error with the main node, after that it will keep trying to restabilish the connection continuously at every interval.
The default reconnection interval is 5000 (5 seconds).

See Also:
Constant Field Values
Value:
"openrds.reconnection.interval"

CONNECT_TIMEOUT

public static final java.lang.String CONNECT_TIMEOUT
This property can be used to define the timeout for "create socket" operations.
All remote method calls are handled by socket transport layer.
If a node crashes, it will not be possible to connect to it anymore, but this situation is only detected when a socket timeout happens.
The default "create socket" timeout is 10000 (10 seconds).
You can lower/raise this value on more/less reliable environments.

Since:
OpenRDS 1.1-beta
See Also:
Constant Field Values
Value:
"openrds.connect.timeout"
